intro: Seseli lanzhouense, commonly known as the Lanzhou seseli, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
